urls.title: China extinguishes a light for freedom
urls.description: This week will almost certainly see the end of Apple Daily, a highly popular tabloid newspaper in Hong Kong. This newspaper is dying not because of finances but because the Chinese Communist Party is scared of impure words. Beijing simply cannot handle what the newspaper's journalists write. (Full disclosure: I wrote a weekly Apple Daily column.)

urls.title: WSJ News Exclusive | How Five Hong Kong Protesters Escaped by Speedboat, Found Freedom in the U.S.
urls.description: The five men barely knew each other before they set off in July 2020, but they were fleeing what they considered to be unfair prosecution and inevitable prison sentences for their roles in pro-democracy protests in 2019.
